intro: Trichostelma ciliatum, commonly known as the silky trichostelma, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are opposite and often have fine hairs, contributing to its common name. Trichostelma ciliatum is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments.
